decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with Condition C.2  any window inserted on  the roof slope forming a side elevation of the dwellinghouse shall be -   (a) obscure - glazed, and (b) non- opening unless the parts of the windows which can be opened more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed of Class C, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with Condition B.2 ( c)  any window inserted on a  wall or roof slope forming a side elevation of the dwellinghouse shall be -   (i) obscure - glazed, and (ii) non- opening unless the parts of the windows which can be opened more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed of Class B, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
